channel.title: Mass. Numbers
channel.description: A qualitative look at Massachusetts politics and policy

item.title: Swing district special election results in a 17-vote margin for Democrat
item.dc:creator: Brent Benson
item.description: Democrat Lisa Field wins Third Bristol special election to replace Carol Doherty by 17 votes

item.title: First post-presidential special election shows signs of Trump-era Democratic strength
item.dc:creator: Brent Benson
item.description: Hannah Bowen won the Massachusetts 6th Essex State Rep district by a much higher margin than Kamala Harris six months ago

item.title: Massachusetts shifts towards Trump
item.dc:creator: Brent Benson
item.description: Demographic factors associated with the shift include rates of college attendance, socio-economic status, race, and ethnicity

item.title: The top eight most competitive state legislative races
item.dc:creator: Brent Benson
item.description: A mix of GOPs incumbents in swing districts and competitive open seats look to be the tightest races according to our fundamentals-based model

item.title: A look at the state primary results
item.dc:creator: Brent Benson
item.description: There were ousted incumbents, some real nail-biters, and a slate of new name winners for open seats

item.title: State Primary Deep Dive
item.dc:creator: Brent Benson
item.description: Contested primaries for the state legislature, Governor's Council, Congress, and Senate

item.title: Will Boston neighborhoods play a role in the 10th Suffolk special election?
item.dc:creator: Brent Benson
item.description: The three candidates bring a lot to the table including their home base.

item.title: Has your city or town gotten more Republican or Democratic over the last 50 years?
item.dc:creator: Brent Benson
item.description: A municipality-based look at Massachusetts presidential voting from 1972 through 2020.

item.title: MA 2022 State Legislative Results
item.dc:creator: Brent Benson
item.description: No major surprises when comparing race results to model fundamentals

item.title: A closer look at the Norfolk, Worcester and Middlesex State Senate fundamentals
item.dc:creator: Brent Benson
item.description: A multi-year shift in the region's partisanship explains Democratic strength

item.title: MA 2022 State Senate General Election Ratings
item.dc:creator: Brent Benson
item.description: A model-based evaluation of the contested Massachusetts State Senate races

item.title: MA 2022 State Representative General Election Ratings
item.dc:creator: Brent Benson
item.description: A model-based evaluation of the contested Massachusetts State Representative races

item.title: Driscoll won Lieutenant Governor primary by having largest geographic reach
item.dc:creator: Brent Benson
item.description: Lesser and Gouveia were not able to expand local support bases

item.title: An overview of the 2022 State Representative Primaries
item.dc:creator: Brent Benson
item.description: A look at the MA State Representative contested primaries

item.title: An overview of the 2022 State Senate Primaries
item.dc:creator: Brent Benson
item.description: A look at the ten contested MA State Senate primaries

item.title: A look at MA State Senate Redistricting
item.dc:creator: Brent Benson
item.description: There are now six majority-minority state senate districts in Massachusetts but only three give minority voters a robust chance of electing their candidate of choice

item.title: Welcome to Mass. Numbers
item.dc:creator: Brent Benson
item.description: Welcome to the Mass. Numbers blog. Mass. Numbers takes a quantiative look as Massachusetts politics and policy.
